llm_rationale: Steady demand of 8 units observed. Ordering 10 units to maintain minimal safety stock while avoiding excess holding costs. Current inventory (2) plus incoming (8) covers immediate demand.
llm_risk_assessment: Low inventory position (2 units) creates stockout risk if demand spikes. Chain-wide low inventory (8 units total) increases systemic risk.

llm_rationale: Retailer signaled 10-unit order plan. Maintaining minimal safety stock while avoiding excess inventory costs.
llm_risk_assessment: Low inventory across chain (2 units each) creates stockout risk. Must balance safety stock against holding costs.

llm_rationale: Wholesaler plans 12-unit order. Ordering 14 units to build minimal safety stock while avoiding excessive holding costs. This balances stockout risk against storage costs.
llm_risk_assessment: Low inventory (2 units) creates stockout risk if demand spikes. Lead time delay means we need buffer stock. Must monitor holding costs carefully.

llm_rationale: Distributor plans 14-unit order. With chain-wide low inventory (2 units each) and healthy profits, scheduling 15 units production balances immediate needs with minimal safety stock while avoiding excessive holding costs
llm_risk_assessment: Chain-wide low inventory creates stockout risk. Production lead time requires careful timing. Must prevent both costly stockouts ($1.5/unit) and excess inventory ($0.5/unit)
